__e: Shall I disrupt my mother's grief to tell her that you're holding out for your 30 pieces of silver?
Not to interrupt the life she had, Not for you or me or anyone.
I'm sorry to interrupt myself, but I think we have a problem.
Guys, again, sorry to interrupt, but I'm pretty sure I have something way more important than whatever Adam's convinced you he's doing.
Uh, you know what, sir-- I'm sorry to interrupt, but is there any way you can just, you know--
I don't mean to pry, but I don't know why are you doing this.
You never want to interfere with a man while he's in the midst of his job.
And, besides, even if I did somehow "come back," I... I just can't barge in on their precious family time.
Well, seeing as how you're so neatly tied up at the moment,
I'm terribly sorry to interrupt you when you're having dinner. - It's just that--
But please, don't let me interrupt your work.
I'm sorry to interrupt your dinner, but this means so much to my two friends.
But we cannot, we must not... use that as an excuse to end the dream that began here.
Sorry, you know, for interrupting your tea, but, um, I was just wondering there if your son could come out for a game of ball.
Now, look, the best thing you can do right now is just break off contact...
Look, I don't want to interrupt your trip down memory lane, but, uh, we're not here for the cash.
I'm so sorry to interrupt your evening, but Tom has a date with me tonight.
This doesn't take anything away from your sasquatch girl from book club.
I don't need to interrupt your work, because I work too.
Sorry to interrupt your little coffee morning, James, but some of us have real work to do.
Sorry to interrupt your breakfast, but we're looking to rent a hotel room for the night.
